name: Gateway Project
description: This is a project done as an entrance step before being admitted into Road to Hire. This project was done with basic understanding of HTML and CSS.

name: Guessing Game API
description: This game was created with the use of JavaScript and its features. The idea of the game is to generate a random number and use Speech Reading feature to detect which number is being said.

name: Code for Justice Hackathon
description: A group of passionate individual who got together to work on an application that would bring awareness to a very serious issue happening.

name: Pokemon Console Game
description: This is a very lightweight yet interactive game played on a code editing console or terminal. It provides an understanding of working with Node.Js

name: React to Do List App
description: Simple application created to demonstrate the usability of React.Js and the use of dynamic objects as well as serving as serving as practice for creating tables and passing information with MySQL. This application lets the user add and remove events from the list

name: H.O.P.E Hackathon
description: The H.O.P.E hackathon is an application created by a team of four developers to demonstrate the use of restful APIs, as well as, to demonstrate adaptability to communicate and work with a new team in a time crunch

name: Budget App
description: This project consist of the use of Node.js and Vanilla JavaScript. The main point of this project was to practice my dexterity with JavaScript.

name: Ecommerce Project
description: This is a step up from the first iteration of this project where only HTML5 and CSS3 was being used. In this iteration I included React.Js as well as different libraries such Bootstrap to elevate the design and accessibility of the application

name: React Friends App
description: In-class project created as a JavaScript practice aim to better my understanding of React.Js, while applying a new found knowledge of MySQL.
